messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 62 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Machine learning based co-creative design framework

Paper Abstract: Abstract We propose a flexible, co-creative framework bringing together multiple machine learning techniques to assist human users to efficiently produce effective creative designs. We demonstrate its potential with a perfume bottle design case study, including human evaluation and quantitative and qualitative analyses.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 62 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 62"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "How can computers be partners in the creative process: classification and commentary on the special issue",
        "What is mixed-initiative interaction",
        "Can computers foster human users’ creativity? theory and praxis of mixed-initiative co-creativity",
        "Mixed-initiative cocreativity",
        "Sentient sketchbook: Computer-assisted game level authoring",
        "Mixed-initiative content creation",
        "Mixed-initiative creative interfaces",
        "Game level generation from gameplay videos",
        "Friend, collaborator, student, manager: How design of an ai-driven game level editor affects creators",
        "Co-creative level design via machine learning",
        "Analogy mining for specific design needs",
        "Ideahound: improving large-scale collaborative ideation with crowd-powered real-time semantic modeling",
        "Enhancements to constrained novelty search: Two-population novelty search for generating game content",
        "Towards an integrated generative design framework",
        "Application of interactive genetic algorithm to fashion design",
        "Suitability of genetic based exploration in the creative design process",
        "Designer modeling for personalized game content creation tools",
        "Holistic package design and consumer brand impressions",
        "New structural design increases gatorade sales up to 50% https://www.packworld.com/article/new-structural-design-increases-gatorade-sales-50",
        "Nielsen cpg innovation report: Packaging sells white paper (http://www.nielsen.com/content/dam/corporate/us/en/reports-downloads/2016-reports/nielsen-packaging-sells-white-paper.pdf)",
        "Aesthetic package design: A behavioral, neural, and psychological investigation",
        "Cognitive science approaches to understanding diagrammatic representations",
        "Generative adversarial nets",
        "Progressive growing of gans for improved quality, stability, and variation",
        "Conditional generative adversarial nets",
        "Generative image inpainting with contextual attention",
        "Image-to-image translation with conditional adversarial networks",
        "Image style transfer using convolutional neural networks",
        "Neural style transfer: A review",
        "Arbitrary style transfer in real-time with adaptive instance normalization",
        "Can: Creative adversarial networks, generating\" art\" by learning about styles and deviating from style norms",
        "Design: Design inspiration from generative networks",
        "Toward A neuro-inspired creative decoder",
        "An experimental evaluation of novelty detection methods",
        "Generative adversarial network based novelty detection using minimized reconstruction error",
        "A baseline for detecting misclassified and out-of-distribution examples in neural networks",
        "Xception: Deep learning with depthwise separable convolutions",
        "Decaf: A deep convolutional activation feature for generic visual recognition",
        "Cnn features off-the-shelf: an astounding baseline for recognition",
        "Reinforcement learning: An introduction (http://incompleteideas.net/book/the-book-2nd.html), 2nd ed.",
        "Impact of product packaging on consumer’s buying behavior",
        "Color spaces for computer graphics",
        "Incremental on-line learning: A review and comparison of state of the art algorithms",
        "Monte Carlo statistical methods",
        "Deep bayesian bandits showdown: An empirical comparison of bayesian deep networks for thompson sampling",
        "Esko artioscad software (https://www.esko.com/en/products/artioscad)",
        "Esko deskpack software (https://www.esko.com/en/products/deskpack/)",
        "Adobe illustrator software (https://www.adobe.com/products/illustrator.html)",
        "Adobe photoshop software (https://www.adobe.com/products/photoshop.html)",
        "Creative edge ic3d software (http://www.creativeedgesoftware.com/ic3d/)",
        "Packaging design platform (https://99designs.com/product-packaging-design)",
        "Packaging design platform (https://www.fiverr.com/categories/graphics-design/product-packaging-design)",
        "Creativeai.net (http://www.creativeai.net/)",
        "Using autonomous agents to improvise music compositions in real-time",
        "A neural representation of sketch drawings",
        "Digits that are not: Generating new types through deep neural nets",
        "Styling with Attention to Details",
        "Outfit Generation and Style Extraction via Bidirectional LSTM and Autoencoder",
        "Recent advance in content-based image retrieval: A literature survey",
        "Google image search (https://images.google.com/)",
        "Assistive tagging: A survey of multimedia tagging with human-computer joint exploration",
        "Active Learning in Recommender Systems"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 62 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Machine learning based co-creative design framework, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
